_header: Fleeth the shot of sweet regard
_description:
A roundel, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 49) — 14 lines

BLHar682.First Lines:
FLeth the shott of swete regardMyn hert without thou willist forto
                    day…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…Which nakid art of wepene and arayffor witty flight is signe
                    of no coward
BLHar682.Note: As written, repeats first words of lines 1-2 at end to indicate going back to first four lines of the roundel.
